chainIDs and operatorTableUpdaters arrays have different lengths      - InvalidChainId: Any chainID is zero      - ChainIDAlreadyWhitelisted: Any chainID is already whitelistedEmits the following events:      - ChainIDAddedToWhitelist: When each chainID is successfully added to the whitelist","params":{"chainIDs":"the chainIDs to add to the whitelist","operatorTableUpdaters":"the operatorSet to calculate the operator table for"},"returns":{"_0":"the encoded operatorTableBytes containing:         - operatorSet details         - curve type from KeyRegistrar         - operator set configuration         - calculated operator table from the calculator contract"}},"constructor":{"details":"Initializes the CrossChainRegistry with immutable dependencies","params":{"_allocationManager":"The allocation manager for operator set validation","_keyRegistrar":"The key registrar for operator set curve type validation","_pauserRegistry":"The pauser registry for pause functionality","_permissionController":"The permission controller for access control","_version":"The semantic version of the contract"}},"createGenerationReservation((address,uint32),address,(address,uint32))":{"details":"Tables are transported at a cadence of `tableUpdateCadence` seconds. The `maxStalenessPeriod` is used to determine the maximummsg.sender must be an authorized caller for operatorSet.avsOnce a generation reservation is created, the operator table will be transported to all chains that are whitelistedIt is expected that the AVS has:      - Deployed or is using a generalizable `OperatorTableCalculator` to calculate its operator's stake weights      - Set the `KeyType` for the operatorSet in the `KeyRegistrar`, even if the AVS is not using the `KeyRegistrar` for operator key management           - Valid Key Types are given in the `IKeyRegistrarTypes.CurveType` enum. The `KeyType` must not be `NONE`      - Created an operatorSet in the `AllocationManager`Reverts for:      - CurrentlyPaused: Generation reservations are paused      - InvalidPermissions: Caller is not an authorized caller for operatorSet.avs      - InvalidOperatorSet: The operatorSet does not exist in the AllocationManager      - KeyTypeNotSet: The key type is not set for the operatorSet in the KeyRegistrar      - GenerationReservationAlreadyExists: A generation reservation already exists for the operatorSet      - InvalidStalenessPeriod: The maxStalenessPeriod is invalidEmits the following events:      - GenerationReservationCreated: When the generation reservation is successfully created      - OperatorTableCalculatorSet: When the operator table calculator is set for the operatorSet      - OperatorSetConfigSet: When the operator set config is set for the operatorSet","params":{"config":"the config to set for the operatorSet, which includes the owner of the operatorSet and the max staleness period","operatorSet":"the operatorSet to make a reservation for","operatorTableCalculator":"the address of the operatorTableCalculator. This contract is deployed (or a template is used) by the AVS                                to calculate the stake weights for the operatorSet. See `IOperatorTableCalculator` for more details"}},"getActiveGenerationReservationCount()":{"details":"This function can be used in conjunction with the paginated version of `getActiveGenerationReservations`      to iterate over all active generation reservations","returns":{"_0":"The number of active generation reservations"}},"getActiveGenerationReservations()":{"returns":{"_0":"An array of operatorSets with active generationReservations"}},"getActiveGenerationReservationsByRange(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Reverts for:      - InvalidRange: startIndex is greater than endIndex      - InvalidEndIndex: endIndex is greater than the length of the active generation reservations array","params":{"endIndex":"the end index of the range, exclusive","startIndex":"the start index of the range, inclusive"},"returns":{"_0":"An array of operatorSets with active generationReservations"}},"getOperatorSetConfig((address,uint32))":{"details":"You should check if an operatorSet has an active whitelistedEmits the following events:      - ChainIDRemovedFromWhitelist: When each chainID is successfully removed from the whitelist","params":{"chainIDs":"the chainIDs to remove from the GenerationReservationDoesNotExist: A generation reservation does not exist for the operatorSetEmits the following events:      - OperatorTableCalculatorRemoved: When the operator table calculator is removed      - OperatorSetConfigRemoved: When the operator set config is removed      - GenerationReservationRemoved: When the generation reservation is removed","params":{"operatorSet":"the operatorSet to remove"}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"setOperatorSetConfig((address,uint32),(address,uint32))":{"details":"msg.sender must be an authorized caller for operatorSet.avsoperatorSet must have an active generation reservationThe max staleness period is NOT checkpointed and is applied globally regardless of the reference timestamp of a certificateReverts for:      - CurrentlyPaused: Setting the operatorSetConfig is paused      - InvalidPermissions: Caller is not an authorized caller for operatorSet.avs      - InvalidOperatorSet: The operatorSet does not exist in the AllocationManager      - GenerationReservationDoesNotExist: A generation reservation does not exist for the operatorSet      - InvalidStalenessPeriod: The maxStalenessPeriod is invalidEmits the following events:      - OperatorSetConfigSet: When the operator set config is successfully set","params":{"config":"the config to set, which includes the owner of the operatorSet and the max staleness period","operatorSet":"the operatorSet to set the operatorSetConfig for"}},"setOperatorTableCalculator((address,uint32),address)":{"details":"msg.sender must be an authorized caller for operatorSet.avsoperatorSet must have an active reservationReverts for:      - GenerationReservationDoesNotExist: A generation reservation does not exist for the operatorSetEmits the following events:      - OperatorTableCalculatorSet: When the operator table calculator is successfully set","params":{"operatorSet":"the operatorSet whose operatorTableCalculator is desired to be set","operatorTableCalculator":"the contract to call to calculate the operator table"}},"setTableUpdateCadence(uint32)":{"details":"msg.sender must be the owner of the CrossChainRegistryThe table update cadence cannot be 0Reverts for:      - \"Ownable: caller is not the owner\": Caller is not the owner of the contract      - InvalidTableUpdateCadence: The tableUpdateCadence is zeroEmits the following events:      - TableUpdateCadenceSet: When the table update cadence is successfully set","params":{"tableUpdateCadence":"the table update cadence"}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). It is permissioned to the `pauser` address, which is expected to be a low threshold multisig."},"pauseAll()":{"notice":"Alias for `pause(type(uint256).max)`."},"paused()":{"notice":"Returns the current paused status as a uint256."},"paused(uint8)":{"notice":"Returns 'true' if the `indexed`th bit of `_paused` is 1, and 'false' otherwise"},"pauserRegistry()":{"notice":"Address of the `PauserRegistry` contract that this contract defers to for determining access control (for pausing)."},"permissionController()":{"notice":"Pointer to the permission controller contract."},"removeChainIDsFromWhitelist(uint256[])":{"notice":"Removes chainIDs from the whitelist of chainIDs"},"removeGenerationReservation((address,uint32))":{"notice":"Removes a generation reservation for a given operatorSet"},"setOperatorSetConfig((address,uint32),(address,uint32))":{"notice":"Sets the operatorSetConfig for a given operatorSet"},"setOperatorTableCalculator((address,uint32),address)":{"notice":"Sets the operatorTableCalculator for the operatorSet"},"setTableUpdateCadence(uint32)":{"notice":"Sets the table update cadence in seconds. This is the frequency at which operator tables are expected to be updated on all destination chains"},"unpause(uint256)":{"notice":"This function is used to unpause an EigenLayer contract's functionality. It is permissioned to the `unpauser` address, which is expected to be a high threshold multisig or governance contract."},"version()":{"notice":"Returns the semantic version string of the contract."}},"notice":"Implementation contract for managing cross-chain operator set configurations and generation reservations","version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"src/contracts/multichain/CrossChainRegistry.sol":"CrossChainRegistry"},"evmVersion":"prague","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[":@openzeppelin-upgrades/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable-v4.9.0/",":@openzeppelin/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts-v4.9.0/",":ds-test/=lib/ds-test/src/",":erc4626-tests/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable-v4.9.0/lib/erc4626-tests/",":forge-std/=lib/forge-std/src/",":openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable-v4.9.0/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable-v4.9.0/",":openzeppelin-contracts-v4.9.0/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts-v4.9.0/",":openzeppelin/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable-v4.9.0/contracts/",":zeus-templates/=lib/zeus-templates/src/"]},"sources":{"lib/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable-v4.9.0/contracts/access/OwnableUpgradeable.sol":{"keccak256":"0x4075622496acc77fd6d4de4cc30a8577a744d5c75afad33fdeacf1704d6eda98","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://99c8cb3cd19a44bbfb6612605affb7d8b06cee1f6aa9362a37a8672b4f7eeaf8","dweb:/ipfs/QmasyxFDBUp7k5KFgfDWEzM8PYSKEq7GVznzMJ1VxVRF4B"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable-v4.9.0/contracts/proxy/utils/Initializable.sol":{"keccak256":"0x89be10e757d242e9b18d5a32c9fbe2019f6d63052bbe46397a430a1d60d7f794","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://f103ee2e4aecd37aac6ceefe670709cdd7613dee25fa2d4d9feaf7fc0aaa155e","dweb:/ipfs/QmRiNZLoJk5k3HPMYGPGjZFd2ke1ZxjhJZkM45Ec9GH9hv"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable-v4.9.0/contracts/utils/AddressUpgradeable.sol":{"keccak256":"0x9c80f545915582e63fe206c6ce27cbe85a86fc10b9cd2a0e8c9488fb7c2ee422","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://310136ad60820af4177a11a61d77a3686faf5fca4942b600e08fc940db38396b","dweb:/ipfs/QmbCzMNSTL7Zi7M4UCSqBrkHtp4jjxUnGbkneCZKdR1qeq"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable-v4.9.0/contracts/utils/ContextUpgradeable.sol":{"keccak256":"0x963ea7f0b48b032eef72fe3a7582edf78408d6f834115b9feadd673a4d5bd149","license": addChainIDsToWhitelist(uint256[],address.details: msg.sender must be the owner of the CrossChainRegistryReverts for:      - "Ownable: caller is not the owner": Caller is not the owner of the contract      - CurrentlyPaused: Chain whitelisting is paused      - ArrayLengthMismatch: The chainIDs and operatorTableUpdaters arrays have different lengths      - InvalidChainId: Any chainID is zero      - ChainIDAlreadyWhitelisted: Any chainID is already whitelistedEmits the following events:      - ChainIDAddedToWhitelist: When each chainID is successfully added to the whitelist

params.chainIDs: the chainIDs to add to the whitelist
params.operatorTableUpdaters: the operatorTableUpdaters for each whitelisted chainID

calculateOperatorTableBytes((address,uin.details: You should check if an operatorSet has an active generation reservation prior to calling this methodThis function aggregates data from multiple sources for cross-chain transportReverts when the call to the operatorTableCalculator contract call fails

params.operatorSet: the operatorSet to calculate the operator table for

returns._0: the encoded operatorTableBytes containing:         - operatorSet details         - curve type from KeyRegistrar         - operator set configuration         - calculated operator table from the calculator contract

constructor.details: Initializes the CrossChainRegistry with immutable dependencies

params._allocationManager: The allocation manager for operator set validation
params._keyRegistrar: The key registrar for operator set curve type validation
params._pauserRegistry: The pauser registry for pause functionality
params._permissionController: The permission controller for access control
params._version: The semantic version of the contract

createGenerationReservation((address,uin.details: Tables are transported at a cadence of `tableUpdateCadence` seconds. The `maxStalenessPeriod` is used to determine the maximummsg.sender must be an authorized caller for operatorSet.avsOnce a generation reservation is created, the operator table will be transported to all chains that are whitelistedIt is expected that the AVS has:      - Deployed or is using a generalizable `OperatorTableCalculator` to calculate its operator's stake weights      - Set the `KeyType` for the operatorSet in the `KeyRegistrar`, even if the AVS is not using the `KeyRegistrar` for operator key management           - Valid Key Types are given in the `IKeyRegistrarTypes.CurveType` enum. The `KeyType` must not be `NONE`      - Created an operatorSet in the `AllocationManager`Reverts for:      - CurrentlyPaused: Generation reservations are paused      - InvalidPermissions: Caller is not an authorized caller for operatorSet.avs      - InvalidOperatorSet: The operatorSet does not exist in the AllocationManager      - KeyTypeNotSet: The key type is not set for the operatorSet in the KeyRegistrar      - GenerationReservationAlreadyExists: A generation reservation already exists for the operatorSet      - InvalidStalenessPeriod: The maxStalenessPeriod is invalidEmits the following events:      - GenerationReservationCreated: When the generation reservation is successfully created      - OperatorTableCalculatorSet: When the operator table calculator is set for the operatorSet      - OperatorSetConfigSet: When the operator set config is set for the operatorSet

params.config: the config to set for the operatorSet, which includes the owner of the operatorSet and the max staleness period
params.operatorSet: the operatorSet to make a reservation for
params.operatorTableCalculator: the address of the operatorTableCalculator. This contract is deployed (or a template is used) by the AVS                                to calculate the stake weights for the operatorSet. See `IOperatorTableCalculator` for more details

getActiveGenerationReservationCount().details: This function can be used in conjunction with the paginated version of `getActiveGenerationReservations`      to iterate over all active generation reservations

returns._0: The number of active generation reservations
An array of operatorSets with active generationReservations

getActiveGenerationReservationsByRange(u.details: Reverts for:      - InvalidRange: startIndex is greater than endIndex      - InvalidEndIndex: endIndex is greater than the length of the active generation reservations array

params.endIndex: the end index of the range, exclusive
params.startIndex: the start index of the range, inclusive

returns._0: An array of operatorSets with active generationReservations

getOperatorSetConfig((address,uint32)).details: You should check if an operatorSet has an active generation reservation prior to calling this method

params.operatorSet: the operatorSet to get the operatorSetConfig for

returns._0: The operatorSetConfig for the given operatorSet

getOperatorTableCalculator((address,uint.details: You should check if an operatorSet has an active generation reservation prior to calling this method

params.operatorSet: the operatorSet to get the operatorTableCalculator for

returns._0: The operatorTableCalculator for the given operatorSet
An array of chainIDs that are supported by the CrossChainRegistry
returns._1: An array of operatorTableUpdaters corresponding to each chainID

getTableUpdateCadence().details: The table update cadence is applicable to all whitelisted chains, and is the      frequency at which operator tables are expected to be updated on all destination chains

returns._0: The table update cadence, in seconds
True if the operatorSet has an active generation reservation, false otherwise

params.initialOwner: The initial owner of the contract

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pause(uint256).details: This function can only pause functionality, and thus cannot 'unflip' any bit in `_paused` from 1 to 0.

params.newPausedStatus: represents the new value for `_paused` to take, which means it may flip several bits at once.

removeChainIDsFromWhitelist(uint256[]).details: msg.sender must be the owner of the CrossChainRegistryReverts for:      - "Ownable: caller is not the owner": Caller is not the owner of the contract      - CurrentlyPaused: Chain whitelisting is paused      - ChainIDNotWhitelisted: Any chainID is not currently whitelistedEmits the following events:      - ChainIDRemovedFromWhitelist: When each chainID is successfully removed from the whitelist

params.chainIDs: the chainIDs to remove from the whitelist

removeGenerationReservation((address,uin.details: msg.sender must be an authorized caller for operatorSet.avsReverts for:      - CurrentlyPaused: Generation reservations are paused      - InvalidPermissions: Caller is not an authorized caller for operatorSet.avs      - InvalidOperatorSet: The operatorSet does not exist in the AllocationManager      - GenerationReservationDoesNotExist: A generation reservation does not exist for the operatorSetEmits the following events:      - OperatorTableCalculatorRemoved: When the operator table calculator is removed      - OperatorSetConfigRemoved: When the operator set config is removed      - GenerationReservationRemoved: When the generation reservation is removed

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setOperatorSetConfig((address,uint32),(a.details: msg.sender must be an authorized caller for operatorSet.avsoperatorSet must have an active generation reservationThe max staleness period is NOT checkpointed and is applied globally regardless of the reference timestamp of a certificateReverts for:      - CurrentlyPaused: Setting the operatorSetConfig is paused      - InvalidPermissions: Caller is not an authorized caller for operatorSet.avs      - InvalidOperatorSet: The operatorSet does not exist in the AllocationManager      - GenerationReservationDoesNotExist: A generation reservation does not exist for the operatorSet      - InvalidStalenessPeriod: The maxStalenessPeriod is invalidEmits the following events:      - OperatorSetConfigSet: When the operator set config is successfully set

params.config: the config to set, which includes the owner of the operatorSet and the max staleness period
params.operatorSet: the operatorSet to set the operatorSetConfig for

setOperatorTableCalculator((address,uint.details: msg.sender must be an authorized caller for operatorSet.avsoperatorSet must have an active reservationReverts for:      - CurrentlyPaused: Setting the operatorTableCalculator is paused      - InvalidPermissions: Caller is not an authorized caller for operatorSet.avs      - InvalidOperatorSet: The operatorSet does not exist in the AllocationManager      - GenerationReservationDoesNotExist: A generation reservation does not exist for the operatorSetEmits the following events:      - OperatorTableCalculatorSet: When the operator table calculator is successfully set

params.operatorSet: the operatorSet whose operatorTableCalculator is desired to be set
params.operatorTableCalculator: the contract to call to calculate the operator table

setTableUpdateCadence(uint32).details: msg.sender must be the owner of the CrossChainRegistryThe table update cadence cannot be 0Reverts for:      - "Ownable: caller is not the owner": Caller is not the owner of the contract      - InvalidTableUpdateCadence: The tableUpdateCadence is zeroEmits the following events:      - TableUpdateCadenceSet: When the table update cadence is successfully set

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

unpause(uint256).details: This function can only unpause functionality, and thus cannot 'flip' any bit in `_paused` from 0 to 1.

params.newPausedStatus: represents the new value for `_paused` to take, which means it may flip several bits at once.

returns._0: The version string in SemVer format (e.g., "1.1.1")

addChainIDsToWhitelist(uint256[],address.notice: Adds chainIDs to the whitelist of chainIDs that are transported to by the multichain protocol

calculateOperatorTableBytes((address,uin.notice: Calculates the operatorTableBytes for a given operatorSet

createGenerationReservation((address,uin.notice: Creates a generation reservation, which transports the operator table of an operatorSet to all whitelisted chains

getActiveGenerationReservationCount().notice: Gets the number of active generation reservations

getActiveGenerationReservationsByRange(u.notice: Gets the active generation reservations by range

getOperatorSetConfig((address,uint32)).notice: Gets the operatorSetConfig for a given operatorSet

getOperatorTableCalculator((address,uint.notice: Gets the operatorTableCalculator for a given operatorSet

getSupportedChains().notice: Gets the list of chains that are supported by the CrossChainRegistry

getTableUpdateCadence().notice: Gets the table update cadence, in seconds

hasActiveGenerationReservation((address,.notice: Checks if a given operatorSet has an active generation reservation

initialize(address,uint32,uint256).notice: Initializes the contract with the initial paused status and owner

pause(uint256).notice: This function is used to pause an EigenLayer contract's functionality. It is permissioned to the `pauser` address, which is expected to be a low threshold multisig.

paused().notice: Returns the current paused status as a uint256.

paused(uint8).notice: Returns 'true' if the `indexed`th bit of `_paused` is 1, and 'false' otherwise

pauserRegistry().notice: Address of the `PauserRegistry` contract that this contract defers to for determining access control (for pausing).

permissionController().notice: Pointer to the permission controller contract.

removeChainIDsFromWhitelist(uint256[]).notice: Removes chainIDs from the whitelist of chainIDs

removeGenerationReservation((address,uin.notice: Removes a generation reservation for a given operatorSet

setOperatorSetConfig((address,uint32),(a.notice: Sets the operatorSetConfig for a given operatorSet

setOperatorTableCalculator((address,uint.notice: Sets the operatorTableCalculator for the operatorSet

setTableUpdateCadence(uint32).notice: Sets the table update cadence in seconds. This is the frequency at which operator tables are expected to be updated on all destination chains

unpause(uint256).notice: This function is used to unpause an EigenLayer contract's functionality. It is permissioned to the `unpauser` address, which is expected to be a high threshold multisig or governance contract.

version().notice: Returns the semantic version string of the contract.
